name: Avoid SQL queries that no index can support
associatedValueName: Database table name accessed without using any index
description:
This metric retrieves the artifacts containing at least one SQL Query not using a table's indexes. 
An SQL Query is using table's indexes if all the following conditions are true: 

- At least one index is defined for each table participating in the from list
- Queries must reference left-most columns of the index key
output:
Associated to each Artifact with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The database table name accessed without using any index
rationale:
SQL Queries that do not use table indexes are extremely dangerous for the application's performance.
Indeed, each execution of the query will result in a full table scan which is extremely time consuming.
reference:
http://it-cisq.org/
CISQ: ASCPEM-PRF-05

Enhancing the Quality of ABAP Development
Meijs - Krouwels - Heuvelmans - Sommen
SAP Press
ISBN 1-59229-030-2
remediation: Try to use indexed columns in WHERE and HAVING clauses. If it is not possible, then create a secondary index for these columns.

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance

qualityStandards.name: MIPS Reduction - focus on data access efficiency
qualityStandards.description: MIPS Reduction assess the level of resources that are wasted on account of sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency and Robustness areas. Sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency cause unnecessary consumption of resources, that will ultimately cause unnecessary consumption of electrical power when applications run in production. Sub-optimal coding regarding Robustness cause unnecessary consumption of resources, when it comes down to application shutdown and restart because it failed or because its integrity was corrupted.

qualityStandards.name: Incorrect indices
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where the syntax of the SQL SELECT statement and the index configuration of the SQL table or SQL view causes the DBMS to run sequential searches
